checkmate.logic.game

Class ChessBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • checkmate.logic.game.ChessBoard

  • public class ChessBoard
extends Object
    Class for the chessboard.
    Author:
    llmlks

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChessBoard()
      Constructor generates empty ArrayLists for pieces and squares.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Square findSquareByCoordinates(int x, int y)
      Finds square at coordinates x and y.
      ArrayList<Piece> getPieces()
      Returns private variable pieces.
      ArrayList<Square> getSquares()
      Returns private variable squares.
      void initPawns()
      Initialises pawns; creates 12 of both colours with appropriate initial squares and adds them to pieces list.
      void initPieces()
      Calls appropriate methods to initialise pieces, i.e.
      void initPiecesExclPawns()
      Initialises pieces other than pawns, creating 12 of each colour with appropriate initial squares, and adding them to pieces list.
      void initSquares()
      Initialises squares; creates 64 squares and adds them to this board's list of squares.
      void promote(Piece p, String promo, Player player)
      Promotes pawn to another piece of the player's choice.
      void setPiecesToSquares()
      Matches all the pieces on board to appropriate squares and vice versa.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChessBoard

        public ChessBoard()
        Constructor generates empty ArrayLists for pieces and squares.

    • Method Detail

      • getSquares

        public final ArrayList<Square> getSquares()
        Returns private variable squares.
        Returns:
        List of squares on the board

      • getPieces

        public final ArrayList<Piece> getPieces()
        Returns private variable pieces.
        Returns:
        List of pieces on the board

      • initSquares

        public final void initSquares()
        Initialises squares; creates 64 squares and adds them to this board's list of squares.

      • initPieces

        public final void initPieces()
        Calls appropriate methods to initialise pieces, i.e. initPawns(), initPiecesExclPawns() and setPiecesToSquares().

      • initPawns

        public final void initPawns()
        Initialises pawns; creates 12 of both colours with appropriate initial squares and adds them to pieces list.

      • initPiecesExclPawns

        public final void initPiecesExclPawns()
        Initialises pieces other than pawns, creating 12 of each colour with appropriate initial squares, and adding them to pieces list.

      • setPiecesToSquares

        public final void setPiecesToSquares()
        Matches all the pieces on board to appropriate squares and vice versa.

      • promote

        public final void promote(Piece p,
                          String promo,
                          Player player)
        Promotes pawn to another piece of the player's choice.
        Parameters:
        p - Pawn to be promoted
        promo - Piece to be promoted to
        player - Player whose piece is promoted

      • findSquareByCoordinates

        public final Square findSquareByCoordinates(int x,
                                            int y)
        Finds square at coordinates x and y.
        Parameters:
        x - integer x coordinate
        y - integer y coordinate
        Returns:
        Square at coordinates x and y, or null if none is found
